item.title: Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii ‘Story’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/like-a-dragon-pirate-yakuza-in-hawaii-story-trailer

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Set sail in search of treasure.

Publisher SEGA and developer Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio have released the official story trailer for Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii.

Here is the game’s story synopsis:

After losing his memory, Goro Majima, a once-feared legend in the yakuza world, sets sail in search of treasure.

Half a year ago teaming up with Kiryu for a massive battle in the Millenium Tower, Goro Majima washes up with the wreckage of a boat on the shore of a remote, sparsely populated island. With no memories—not even his own name—Majima joins forces with Noah, the young islander who saved his life, and embarks on a search for clues to his forgotten past. However, what waits for them is a powder-keg world where scoundrels vie for a legendary treasure.

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 21 worldwide.

item.title: MSX2 RPG BURAI Joukan coming to Switch in early summer in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/msx2-rpg-burai-joukan-coming-to-switch-in-early-summer-in-japan

  • Switch

Sequel and more classic ports to follow.

Mebius will release a Switch version of Riverhill Soft-developed MSX2 RPG BURAI Joukan (BURAI Volume One) in the early summer in Japan, the company announced.

BURAI Joukan was a big RPG project at the time of its release, with a story written by Takeo Iijima (now known as Takiya Iijima), character design and original artwork by Shingo Araki and Michi Himeno, and music by female rock band SHOW-YA.

According to Mebius, the game is known for its over 40 minutes-long opening, story surrounding eccentric characters, beautiful graphics, and sensational sound quality.

The Switch version of BURAI Joukan will feature save / load and rewind functionalities, as well as wallpaper customization, digital manual viewing, and more. Data can also be linked to sequel BURAI Gekan: Kanketsuhen (BURAI Volume Two: Final Chapter), which will follow at a later date.

For this release, Mebius is developing “MSXPLAYer” for Switch in cooperation with MSX Association. This is an official MSX emulator, licensed by MSX Licensing Corporation, that can run MSX games in various environments, including Switch. BURAI Joukan will be the first title to utilize it.

Going forward, Mebius plans to regularly release titles licensed by MSX Licensing Corporation and port numerous classic works.

Watch a trailer below.

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II ‘Datavault’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/warhammer-40000-space-marine-ii-datavault-update-now-available

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

New challenges, reward, map, enemy, and more.

Publisher Focus Entertainment and developer Saber Interactive have released the “Datavault” update for third-person action game Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II, which adds the new Battle-Barge chamber “Datavault,” new Ordeals, new rewards, new player-versus-player arena “Tomb,” new enemy “Biovore,” the “Salamanders Champion Pack” and “Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack,” and difficulty level “Absolute.”

Get the details below.

New Challenges and Rewards Await in the Datavault!

Directly accessible through the Armory, today’s main addition comes in the form of the Datavault, a brand-new Battle-Barge chamber where Tech-Priests collect and store intel on the many enemies of the Imperium. By completing Ordeals, players will accumulate Research Data that they’ll be able to trade for Requisition Points and new cosmetics like pauldron markings, weapon skins (Thunder Hammer, Auto Bolt Rifle) and even new armor pieces (breastplate, gauntlet).

A New Map Comes to Player-Versus-Player While the Biovore Invades Operations Mode

With today’s update, Eternal War mode gets its first new player-versus-player map since launch with the Necron-themed “Tomb” map.

Operations players, meanwhile, will need to keep an eye out for the new Tyranid Biovore, a devastating Majoris enemy able to deal damage both from afar and up close.

Season Pass brings the Raven Guard and Salamanders

In addition to these new challenges, Season Pass owners today receive the “Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack” and the “Salamanders Champion Pack.” The first comes with the iconic, fan-favorite Mark VI “Corvus” helmet and over 40 cosmetics to celebrate the Raven Guard Successor Chapters, while the latter brings a new Champion skin for the Sniper class and an exclusive Bolt Sniper Rifle skin.

“Absolute” Difficulty Now Available, Amidst Huge Quality-of-Life Improvements

Besides its free and Season Pass content, “Datavault” also delivers the sixth and final difficulty setting, aptly named “Absolute,” as well as significant quality-of-life features for PC and console players alike. These include the addition of an opt-in/opt-out Crossplay feature in player-versus-player matches, an FOV slider on PC, a number of tweaks to class perks, and a “currency exchange,” allowing players to trade their Armory Data for rarer tiers or even Requisition Points! More details can be found in our official “Datavault” patch notes.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Wizardry Variants Daphne tops one million downloads
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/wizardry-variants-daphne-tops-one-million-downloads

  • Smartphone

In-game commemoration giveaway and limited-time events announced.

3D dungeon RPG Wizardry Variants Daphne has surpassed one million downloads, publisher Drecom and developer Studio 2PRO announced. It launched for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play on October 15, 2024.

To commemorate the milestone, a seven-day giveaway will begin today and ending February 19. Users who log-in daily will receive the following items:

  • Day 1: Adventurer’s Remain (x10)
  • Day 2: Gem of Org (x500)
  • Day 3: Gem of Org (x500)
  • Day 4: Class Change Guidance Certificate (x1)
  • Day 5: Gem of Org (x350)
  • Day 6: Gem of Org (x350)
  • Day 7: Gem of Org (x300)

Items can be claimed via “Adventurer’s Guild” –> “Supplies” –> Special Supplies. Up to seven days worth of unclaimed rewards can be claimed at once during the event period.

Additionally, the following limited-time missions are also planned:

Archive of Guidance Missions

  • Event Period: February 6 to February 19 at 23:59 JST

Assassins in the Dark of Night Missions will be held. These are special missions in which you can obtain Class Change Guidance Certificates, 10,000 gold, and more by completing the designated missions and obtaining a certain number of points.

Offers from the Exchange: Archive of Guidance

  • Event Period: February 6 to February 26 at 23:59 JST

During the event period, you can obtain Class Change Guidance Certificates through special supplies and mission rewards. Class Change Guidance Certificates can be exchanged at the Jeweler’s Exchange Archive of Guidance for Adventurer’s Handbooks.

Legendary Adventurer: New Handbooks

  • Implementation Date: February 13 (after maintenance)

Handbooks for the following characters will be added:

  • Fighter’s Handbook (Gerard)
  • Knight’s Handbook (Gerard)
  • Fighter’s Handbook (Abenius)
  • Priest’s Handbook (Abenius)

Den Dispatch Requests

  • Event Period: February 13 to February 19 at 23:59 JST

During the event period, you will be able to accept dispatch requests to Dens. To accept these dispatch requests, you must first clear each respective Den during the event.

  • Den of Earth B1F Exploration
  • Den of Fire B1F Exploration
  • Den of Air B1F Exploration
